title: Corrosion and thermal characterization of styrene based copolymers
abstract: Abstract Films from copolymers with resistance to wear, corrosion and thermal degradation as well as other important functions have been applied in many fields. It is known that the introduction of anionic hydrophilic groups in the polymer enhances its adhesion to substrates and protective function. In the present work, copolymers of styrene with acrylic, methacrylic and itaconic acids were prepared by polymerization in toluene with benzoyl peroxide initiation (BPO) and have been tested as anticorrosive films. The copolymers were analyzed by FTIR and TGA methods. Polarizing microscope images were employed to characterize the anticorrosive properties of the formed films. All copolymers produced in this work show strong adhesion to the substrate.

motivations: There is a need for materials with improved resistance to wear, corrosion, and thermal degradation for various applications.
Enhancing the adhesion and protective function of polymers is crucial for their effectiveness in protective coatings.
objectives: Develop and characterize styrene-based copolymers with improved corrosion and thermal resistance.
Investigate the effect of introducing anionic hydrophilic groups on the adhesion and protective function of the copolymers.
methods: Prepare copolymers of styrene with acrylic, methacrylic, and itaconic acids through polymerization in toluene with benzoyl peroxide initiation.
Analyze the copolymers using FTIR, TGA, and polarizing microscope images to characterize their properties.
results: The developed copolymers exhibit strong adhesion to substrates and show promise as anticorrosive films.
The introduction of anionic hydrophilic groups enhances the protective function of the copolymers.

motivations: There is a need for polymer films with enhanced resistance to wear, corrosion, and thermal degradation for various industrial applications.
Improving polymer adhesion to substrates through the introduction of anionic hydrophilic groups can enhance their protective function.
objectives: Synthesize and characterize styrene-based copolymers with acrylic, methacrylic, and itaconic acids for use as anticorrosive films.
Evaluate the thermal stability, adhesion properties, and anticorrosive performance of the synthesized copolymers.
methods: Copolymers were prepared through polymerization in toluene using benzoyl peroxide as an initiator.
Characterization was performed using FTIR spectroscopy, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), and polarizing microscopy.
results: All synthesized copolymers demonstrated strong adhesion to substrates.
The copolymer films showed promising anticorrosive properties as characterized by polarizing microscopy.
